title: 1987년 Seibert 사건
summary: 미국 Wisconsin, WI 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: Seibert. 판결일: 1987-09-01. 법원: Court of Appeals of Wisconsin.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: STATE of Wisconsin, Plaintiff-Respondent, v. Ruven SEIBERT, Defendant-Appellant
**판결일**: 1987-09-01
**법원**: Court of Appeals of Wisconsin
**관할**: Wisconsin, WI

**판사**: Cane, LaROCQUE, LaRocque, Myse

## 변호인

For defendant-appellant, there were briefs by Jack E. Schairer, assistant state public defender, Madison., For plaintiff-respondent, tbere was a brief by Donald J. Hanaway, attorney general and Christopher G. Wren, assistant attorney general, Madison.

## 인용

- 416 N.W.2d 900
- 141 Wis. 2d 753

## 판결문 요약


141 Wis. 2d 753 (1987)
416 N.W.2d 900
STATE of Wisconsin, Plaintiff-Respondent,
v.
Ruven SEIBERT,[] Defendant-Appellant.
No. 87-0192-CR.
Court of Appeals of Wisconsin.
Submitted on briefs June 15, 1987.
Decided September 1, 1987.
*757 For defendant-appellant, there were briefs by Jack E. Schairer, assistant state public defender, Madison.
For plaintiff-respondent, there was a brief by Donald J. Hanaway, attorney general and Christopher G. Wren, assistant attorney general, Madison.
Before Cane, P.J., LaRocque and Myse, JJ.
LaROCQUE, J.
Ruven Seibert appeals a judgment of conviction and an order denying postconviction relief for feloniously conspiring to intimidate a witness contrary to sec. 940.43(4), Stats. Section 940.42, Stats., punishes as a misdemeanor the crime of intimidating a witness, while sec. 940.43(4), under which Seibert was charged, punishes the same offense as a felony "where the act is in furtherance of any conspiracy." Seibert claims that the felony statute does not apply unless the conspiracy is other than one to intimidate the witness. He also claims that the trial court improperly restricted cross-examination; that he was denied due process when a defense witness was allowed to plead the fifth amendment, by the state's *758 references to other crimes, and by defective jury instructions. We reject Seibert's assertions and affirm.
Seibert stands convicted of conspiring with Nancy Schneske, the mother of a fourteen-year-old, M.C.L., to convince M.C.L. to re...
